page.title: 13BADGERS ON THE LONG MYND
page.content: One of the main{badger woods}on the {Longmynd}is about one and a half miles outside Ratlinghope on the road to Church Stretton over the Longmynd.It is a{conifer wood}and most of the setts are at the top of the wood near the road.The best time to go badger watching is about nine in the evening just before it gets dark.You must be careful to get in a good postion downwind of the badgers because although they have poor eyesight their sense of smell is excellent.By taking up such a position it is easily possible to get within a few feet of them and watch completely unobserved.
